name: Lime Tree Bay Resort Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Daily housekeeping is not what it should be. Inconsistent on what type of towels- one day two bath towels and one hand towel, the next two bath towels, a hand towel, and a floor towel. We are on day 4 and the toilet has yet to be cleaned. That said, when the shower had a problem (kept shutting off) it was promptly fixed.
reviews.title: Old but well maintained....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read negatives about this hotel before I booked and almost did not book....That would have been a great mistake. This place is awesome. Beautiful, layed back in the middle of the Keys so you don't have to go to far to Key West to check out the action or Key Largo to check out John Pennekamps reef. It is right on the Gulf of Mexico....well the west side of Florida.. They call it the bay but it is the Gulf. Beautiful sunsets! Free Kayaks and bikes, two little convenience stores and deli's across the street. Very clean well maintained property. I almost don't want to tell anyone about it so they will have room for me when I come back!!!!! We got a waterfront king with full kitchen for around 268 (including tax) for two nights. That is 116 a night. We drove down to Key West on Sunday July 14th and stopped at each hotel we were thinking about staying after our two days in Key West. Post Card Inn, Pelican Cove, Drop Anchor, ect...then we got to Lime tree and right away said to ourselves this is it. I don't care what the rooms look like. Well, we booked and came back two days later and were very impressed with our room. We are actually still here. I am typing right now sitting under there tiki huts right on the gulf. Their wifi actually works great in our room and we are about as far away as you can be from office. So excited to find such an awesome gem. I remember reading a post that said ac was too loud. We turn ours all the way down because it was too cold last night with ac on so in the morning we kicked it back up and it was loud for a few minutes then went to a quiet hum. Didn't bother us at all but I do fall asleep with tv on. There is a place to get into the gulf to swim and snorkel, there is a dock to fish or sit and there pool is beautiful. There are hammocks and lounges all over the place......Totally Love this little gem!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Wow what a great little hidden gem

reviews.text: See below for my review under tips for travelers....Could be a darling place to stay if cleaner and maintained better. Also, if restaurants were closer. Closest restaurant was about a 15 min car ride.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: I absolutely love Lime Tree Bay Resort! What an awesome vacation spot! We were right in the middle of the keys and could head in any direction to visit any of the other keys. It was not a long drive to get to Key West, yet it was far enough away that we didn't have a large amount of people around at all hours of the day and night. I loved the drive to the different keys over the bridges watching the crystal clear water change into all different shades of blue. So beautiful!!
reviews.title: We WILL be back!
Our New Fave Spot in Keys
reviews.text: We stayed in the 3 bedroom 3 bath townhouse. It was great because it has its own parking under the unit. (Units 1 and 2 have 2 parking spots each.) The townhouse is 3 stories; first floor was our catch all. We kept our fishing and snorkel gear there out of the way of traffic which kept tracking sand throughout the place to a minimum! The second floor was a bedroom, full bath, kitchen, dining/living room and a large balcony overlooking canal. The 3rd floor was a bedroom with full bath leading off of the room and a master bedroom with a balcony looking over the canal. Our unit was exceptionally clean and fully stocked. It even had its own BBQ gill. I wish that I had brought more food to cook. We made a trip to the grocery store, about a 20 minute drive to Marathon, to pick up supplies so that we could cook our fresh caught fish. It was to die for! So yummy!

reviews.title: Don't do it!!
reviews.text: Greetings, I hope Fellow travellers will read this review and save their vacation !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok let's get to the point, My wife and I picked this place thourgh Expedia the photos of the grounds looked
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fantastic and the price seemed ok, now for the shock, We were given room 106 (deluxe studio ) first floor
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.text: ocean view. Upon entering the room the first thing that got our attention was the stench of the air-conditioning.
reviews.title: Don't stay here. Don't let the pictures fool you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I work in the industrial air-conditioning and refrigeration business I Knew what the Odor was all about (mold and mildew).
reviews.title: Stayed 2 nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great view of the Gulf side at the Lime Tree! This was my third time to stay here, each time seems to get better. I would recommend the this spot if your looking for a great place to admire the gorgeous sunsets. Located just far enough away from Key West to run down for dinner and taking in the sights, and back to the tranquil Lime Tree Bay Resort! My boy friend and I will certainly will return to this little peace of Paradise!
reviews.title: what a great place for a little R&R

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Cruising down the keys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our way down to Key West, we decided to take it easy and make several stops on way to enjoy ourselves.
reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked at the LimeTree Bay Motel in Long Key - the website looked great and sold me, maybe i should have read reviews before!
reviews.title: Dissapointed
Amazing room
reviews.text: We stayed here just one night last week, we were given the hemmingway suite, and I must say it was amazing . Infact it was perfect. Very helpful staff, lovely location excellent view. Lovely comfy sun loungers . Great pool and jacuzzi. Free kayaks. Would have stayed a 2nd night but it was fully booked

Truly enjoyed it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Sunset is amazing. Great deal for the money. Water was perfect and room was updated, clean and pleasant. Best stay ever. Also loved the grills. And free breakfast.
reviews.title: best stay ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only gave you four because I come from working in HR at a four star diamond hotel. A couple of standards at our par were not reached. Otherwise definitely would have gotten a five.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my 3 day 2 night stay

reviews.text: The location at first glance looks tiny but back view and room awesome. Loved my view. My requests prior to arriving were met. Ocean view, mini kitchen :) Everyone was helpful but not engaging. Coming from an engaging environment I was a little disappointed. We arrived early and stopped by to see if our room would be available earlier. Front desk clerk was very nice but not engaging. Didn't offer other options or suggest things to do. First night was pleasant
reviews.title: Management pay attention!

reviews.text: Second day called front desk to request no housekeeping required and didn't fulfill my request. When we got back from day out, our room had been cleaned and bed made. Nothing was missing. A little disappointed.
reviews.title: Paradise

description: In the heart of the Keys, 1/2 way from Miami to Key West....Comfortable, reasonable rates a great place to relax and enjoy spectacular sunsets. We are quiet and peaceful. Mini suites with kitchens, large suites with 2 bedrooms and basic standard hotel rooms. All with a water view. Free parking, free wi-fi and complimentary continental breakfast.
